intro: Sopubia argentea, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Sopubia argentea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry forests and scrublands.
